scenarioDescription:
The HR 2562 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HR 2562 is a star with 1.3 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 110.92 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HR 2562 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HR 2562 system


HR 2562 b

HR 2562 b was discovered by the Gemini Observatory observatory, in 2016-09, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 20.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 2562 b is 9540.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 2562 b is 12.442 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HR 2562 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HR 2562, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Gemini Observatory.
name: HR 2562 - System With 1 Exoplanet
